Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Mm-hmm!

Dialogue: And the Royal Navy chasing us all around the Atlantic.

Speaker: marty
Dialogue: And the hurricane!

Speaker: crew
Dialogue: Aye.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: All in all, it's seems some time since we did a speck of honest pirating.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Shiny?

Dialogue: Aye, shiny.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Is that how you're all feeling, then? Perhaps dear old Jack is not serving your best interests as captain?

Dialogue: Awk! Walk the plank!

Dialogue: Ohhh!  [Jack attempts to shoot the monkey with his pistol, his pistol misfires]

Dialogue: Keys... unlock... *things*?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: And whatever this key unlocks, *inside* there's something valuable. So, we're setting out to find whatever this key unlocks!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: No! If we don't have the key, we can't open whatever it is we don't have that it unlocks. So what purpose would be served in finding whatever need be unlocked, which we don't have, without first having found the key what unlocks it?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: So - We're going after this key!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You're not making any sense at all. Any more questions?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Cap'n?

Speaker: jack sparrow

Speaker: elizabeth swann

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: I have been to Isla de Muerta, I have seen the treasure myself. There is something you need to know.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Consider into your calculations that you robbed me of my wedding night.

Dialogue: These aren't going to Jack.  LORD CUTLER BECKETT Oh really. To ensure Mister Turner's freedom, then? I'll still want that Compass. Consider that in your calculations.

Dialogue: This... is going to save Elizabeth?

Dialogue: Not much.

Dialogue: Yeah, it's gonna save Elizabeth.

Dialogue: No! That - that will just anger the spirit, Sir. What we need to do is find out what the spirit needs, and then just get it back!

Dialogue: Enough! Enough! You're a pair of superstitious goats and it's got the best of you. Now this appears to be no more as we have a stowaway aboard. A young woman, by the look of it. I want you to search the ship and find 'er. Oh, and uh... she's probably naked.

Dialogue: Why is Jack afraid of the open ocean?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: They say the stench of its breath is like - ooh! Imagine: The last thing you know on God's green earth is the roar of the Kraken, and the reeking odor of a thousand rotting corpses. If you believe such things.

Dialogue: And the key will spare him that?

Dialogue: I brought payment.  [Jack whistles once, a crewmember brings in the monkey in a cage]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Look!  [Jack cocks his pistol, shoots the monkey, the bullet has no effect, but the monkey chatters in fright]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: An undead monkey! Top that!

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: No! You've no idea how long it took us to catch that.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: The payment is fair.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: We're looking for this.  And what it goes to.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: The Compass you bartered from me. It cannot lead you to dis?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Maybe. Why?

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Ayeee... Jack Sparrow does not know what he wants! Or... do know, but are loathe to claim it as your own. Your key go to a chest, and it is what lay inside the chest you seek, don't it?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: What *is* inside?

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Gold! Jewels? Unclaimed properties of a valuable nature?

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Nothing... bad, I hope.  [a jar of eyeballs is hanging next to Ragetti's face as he speaks]

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: You know of... Davy Jones, yes? A man of de sea. A great sailor, until he ran afoul of dat which vex all men.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: What vexes all men?

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: What, indeed.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: The sea?

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Sums!

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Dichotomy of good and evil.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: A *woman*.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: A wo-*man*. He fell in love.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: No-no-no-no, I heard it was the *sea* he fell in love with.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Same story, different versions, and all are true. See, it was a *woman*, as changing, and harsh, and untamable as the sea. Him never stopped loving her. But the pain it cause 'im was too much to live wid. But not enough to cause him to die.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: What... exactly did he put into the chest?

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Him heart.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Literally, or figuratively?

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: He couldn't li'erally put his heart in a chest!  Could he?

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: It was not wort' feeling what... small fleeting joy life brings, and so... he carved out him heart, lock it away in a chest, and hide de chest from de world. De keys, he keep wid him at all times.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: You knew this.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I did not. I didn't know where the key was. But now we do. So all that's left is to climb aboard the Flying Dutchman, grab the key, you go back to Port Royal and save your bonnie lass, hey!

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Let me see your hand.  [Jack shows his right hand is untouched, but Tia unwraps the bandage on his left hand]

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Uhhh! The black spot!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: My eyesight's as good as ever, just so you know.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: I am justMy little ###, where are you? ###

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Davy Jones cannot make port. Cannot step on land but once every ten years. Land is where you are safe, Jack Sparrow. And so you will carry land wid you...

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Dirt. This is a jar of dirt.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Is the... jar of dirt going to help?

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: If you don' want it, give it back.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Den it helps.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: It seems... we have a need to find the Flying Dutchman.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: A touch... of destiny!  [Tia throws the crab claws down on the table to see how they fall]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: That's the Flying Dutchman? She doesn't look like much.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Neither do you. Do *not* underestimate her.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Must've run afoul of the reef.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: So what's your plan, then?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I row over, search the ship until I find your bloody key.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: And if there are crewmen?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I cut down anyone in my path.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I like it. Simple, easy to remember.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Your chariot awaits you, sire! Ha, ha-ha-ha, ha-ha!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Hey! If you *do* happen to get captured, just say Jack Sparrow sent you to settle his debt! Might save your life!

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Bon voyage! Ha-ha-ha!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Douse the lamps.

Speaker: scuttled ship
Dialogue: before attack  [Will goes aboard the ship, lantern in hand]  [Will passes one dead crewman at deck level, proped up behind net-like rigging]

Speaker: wounded sailor
Dialogue: ...up the...

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Sailor!

Speaker: wounded sailor
Dialogue: ...the stench...capsized...

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Sailor!

Speaker: wounded sailor
Dialogue: ...bring a...

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: There's no use. You've run aground.

Speaker: wounded sailor
Dialogue: No! Beneath us! Foul breath!  [behind Will, a crewmember's body falls from a height, splashing into the water]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Hey! Hey!

Speaker: greenbeard
Dialogue: Down on your marrowbones, and pray.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Get back! Back!  [Will slices open the stomach of one of the invaders, fish spill out of it onto the deck]

Speaker: scuttled ship
Dialogue: after attack

Speaker: maccus
Dialogue: Five men still alive. The rest have moved on.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Do you fear death?  Do you fear that dark abyss? All your deeds laid bare. All your sins punished.  I can offer you... an escape-uh.

Speaker: chaplain
Dialogue: Don't listen to him!  [Jones walks over to the chaplain, takes the chaplain's head in his claw]

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Do you not fear death?

Speaker: chaplain
Dialogue: I'll take my chances, Sir.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: To the depths.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Life is cruel.  Why should the afterlife be any *different*? I offer you a choice. Join my crew, and postpone the judgment. One hundred years before the mast. Will ye serve?

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: I - I will, serve.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: ?Grand.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: *You* are neither dead nor dying. What is your purpose here?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Jack Sparrow sent me to settle his debt.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: What is your purpose here?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Jack Sparrow. He sent me to settle his debt.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Huh! Did he, now? I'm sorely tempted to accept that offer.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: You have a debt to pay. You've been captain of the Black Pearl for thirteen years. *That* was our agreement.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Technically, I was only captain for two years, then I was viciously mutinied upon.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Then you were a poor captain, but a *captain* nonetheless! Have you not introduced yourself all these years as *Captain* Jack Sparrow?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You have my payment. One soul to serve on your ship is already over there.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: One soul is not equal to another.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Aha! So we've established my proposal is sound in principle, now we're just haggling over price.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Price? Pttt!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Just how many souls do you think my soul is worth?

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: One hundred souls, three days-uh.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You're a diamond, mate. Send me back the boy, I'll get started right off.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: I keep the boy. A good-faith payment. That leaves you only ninety-nine more to go. Ha ha! Ha ha! Ha ha!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Have you not met Will Turner? He's noble, heroic, *terrific* soprano. Worth at least four... maybe three and a half. And did I happen to mention... he's in love. With a girl. Due to be married. Betrothed.  Dividing him from her and her from him... would only be half as cruel as actually allowing them be joined in holy matrimony. Aye?

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: I keep the boy. Ninety-nine souls-uh. But I wonder, Sparrow, can you live with this? Can you condemn an innocent man - a friend-uh - to a lifetime of servitude, in your name while you roam free?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Yep! I'm good with it. Should we seal it in blood? I mean... mm-mm - ink?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Uh!

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Three days.  Three days.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Oh, Mr. Gibbs.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Aye.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Uh, I feel sullied and unusual.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: And how do you intend to harvest these ninety-nine souls in three days?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Fortunately, he was mum as the condition in which these souls need be.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Ah... Tortuga!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Tortuga.

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: It's an outrage. Port tariffs, berthing fees, *wharf* handling, and heaven help us, pilotage. Are we all to work for the East India Trading Company, then?

Speaker: quartermaster
Dialogue: I'm afraid, Sir... Tortuga is the only free port left in these waters.

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: A *pirate* port is what you mean. Well, I'm sorry. An honest sailor is what I am. I make my living fair, and I sleep well each night, thank you.

Speaker: bursar
Dialogue: S-S-Sir!

Speaker: bursar
Dialogue: She wants you to... do something.

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: She's tryna give a sign.  [the dress sweeps over a lantern, knocking it over and part of the deck ignites]

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: Over there! Look for a sign!  [the crew rush to the railing and look out at the sea]  [Elizabeth, up on the mast overhead, sighs in exasperation]

Speaker: quartermaster
Dialogue: Look there! There it is. There's the sign.

Speaker: quartermaster
Dialogue: S-Seaweed can be a sign.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: What's that over there?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: And what makes you think you're worthy to crew the Black Pearl?

Speaker: elderly man
Dialogue: Truth be told, I never sailed a day in me life. I figure I should get out and see the world while I'm still young.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: You'll do. Make your mark. Next!

Speaker: jilted man
Dialogue: My wife ran off with my dog. And I'm drunk for a month. And I don't give a ass rat's if I live or die.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Perfect! Next!

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: It's the crow's nest for you.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I know what I want.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Next!

Speaker: romantic man
Dialogue: Ever since I was a little lad, I've always wanted to sail the seas. Forever.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Sooner than you think. Sign the roster.

Speaker: romantic man
Dialogue: Thanks very much.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: How we going?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Including those four? That gives us - four!

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: And what's *your* story?

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: My story... it's exactly the same as your story, just one chapter behind. I chased a man across the Seven Seas. The pursuit cost me my crew, my commission, and my life.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Commodore?

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: No, not anymore, weren't you *listening*? I nearly had you all, off Tripoli. I would have, if not for the... hurricane.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Lord. You didn't try to sail through it?

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: So do I make your crew, or not? You haven't said where you're going. Somewhere *nice*!

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: So am I *worthy* to serve under Captain Jack Sparrow?

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Or should I just kill you now?  [Jack ducks back and forth behind both sides of a large post, as Norrington points his pistol at Jack]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You're hired.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Sorry. Old habits and all that.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Time to go?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Aye!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Thanks, mate.  [Jack slaps him on the shoulder, the man falls backwards off the balcony]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Carry on.  Heave!  [the two men throw the carried man off the balcony, then Jack continues on his way]

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Come on, men! Who wants some? Form an orderly line, I'll have you all one by one. Come on, who's first?

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: I just wanted the pleasure of doing that myself!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: James Norrington.  What has the world done to you?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Step aside!

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Will you now? And what would prompt such an act of charity?

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Ha ha ha ha! Ha ha! What fortuitous circumstance be this! Five lashes be owed. I believe it is.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: The cat's out of the bag, Mister Turner. Your issue will feel its sting be it the Bo'sun's hand, by your own.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Bo'sun!  [Bootstrap reluctantly takes the whip]  [two crewmen tear Will's shirt off, exposing his bare back]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I don't need your help!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: So I'm to understand what *you* did was an act of compassion?

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: below deck  [Bootstrap and Will enter the interior of the ship together]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I've sworn no oath.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Not until I find this. The key.

Speaker: wyvern
Dialogue: The deadman's chest.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: What do you know of this?

Speaker: wyvern
Dialogue: Open the chest with the key, and stab the heart. No-no-no-no. Don't stab the heart. The Dutchman needs a living heart, or there'll be no captain. And if there's no captain, there's no one to have the key.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: So the captain has the key.  [Wyvern retracts his head back into the wall, having said too much]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Where *is* the key?

Speaker: wyvern
Dialogue: Hidden.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Where is the chest?

Speaker: wyvern
Dialogue: Hidden.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Captain Sparrow!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Come to join me crew, lad? Welcome aboard.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: I'm here to find the man I love.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I'm deeply flattered, son, but my first and only love is the sea.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Meaning William Turner, Captain Sparrow.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Elizabeth.  Hide the rum.  [Gibbs takes the bottle that Jack hands to him, and walks up the boarding plank in the background]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You know, these clothes do not flatter you at all. It should be a dress or nothing. I happen to have no dress in my cabin.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Jack. I know Will came to find you. Where is he?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Darling, I am truly unhappy to have to tell you this but... through an unfortunate and *entirely* unforeseeable series of circumstances that have nothing whatsoever to do with me, poor William has been press-ganged into Davy Jones' crew.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Davy Jones?

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Oh, please. The captain of the Flying Dutchman.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You look bloody awful. What are you doing here?

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: You *hired* me. I can't help it if your standards are lax.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You *smell* funny.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Jack. All I want is to find Will.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Are you certain? Is that what you really want most?

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: 'Course.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Because I would think, you'd want to find a way to *save* Will the most.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: And you have a way of doing that?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Well, there is a chest...

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Oh, dear.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: A chest of unknown size and origin.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: What contains the still-beating heart o' Davy Jones.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Unh-unh... unh-unh... unh-unh...

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: And whoever possesses that chest possesses the leverage to command Jones to do whatever it is he or she wants, including... saving brave William from his grim fate.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: You don't actually believe him, do you?

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: How do we find it?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: With this. My Compass... is unique.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: "Unique" here having the meaning of broken.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: True enough. This Compass does not point north.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Where does it point?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: It points to the thing you want most in this world.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Oh Jack! Are you telling the truth?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Every word, love. And what you want most in this world is to find the chest of Davy Jones, is it not?

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: To save Will?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: By finding the chest of Davy Jones.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Mister Gibbs!

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Cap'n.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: We have our heading.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Finally! Cast off those lines, weigh anchor, and prow that canvas!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Miss Swann.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Welcome to the crew, former Commodore! Heh-heh-heh-heh-heh-heh-heh-heh...

Speaker: port royal
Dialogue: EITC headquarters

Speaker: mercer
Dialogue: Most recently seen on the island of Tortuga, then left, in the company of a known pirate, Jack Sparrow. *And* other fugitives from justice.

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: deck

Speaker: maccus
Dialogue: I wager... ten years.

Speaker: greenbeard
Dialogue: Agreed.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: It's a game of deception. Your bet includes all the dice, not just your own.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: What are they wagering?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: So any crewman can be challenged?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I challenge Davy Jones.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: I accept ?that-uh.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: The stakes?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: My soul. An eternity of servitude.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Against?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I want this.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: How do you know of the key?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: That's not part of the game, is it? You can still walk away.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: No! Don't do this.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Four fours.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Four fives.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Seven fives-uh.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Eight fives.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Huh huh huh. Welcome to the crew, liar.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: And be called a liar myself for my trouble? Bootstrap Bill, you're a liar and you will spend an eternity on this ship! Master Turner, feel free to go ashore... the very next time we make port!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Fool. Why did you do that?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: It was never about winning, or losing.

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: organ room  [nighttime on deck of the Flying Dutchman]  [Will emerges from a hatch on deck]  [Will sneaks past one one the crew on deck, who is sleeping with a bottle in his hand]

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: deck

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: It's not a fate you had to choose for yourself, either.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: They'll know you helped me.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I take this with a promise. I'll find a way to sever Jones' hold on you. And not rest until this blade pierces his heart. I will not abandon you. I promise.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Beckett!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Yes, they're signed, Lord Cutler Beckett of the East India Trading Company.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Agh.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Will was working for Beckett, and never said a word.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Agh.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Beckett wants the Compass. Only one reason for that.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Of course. He wants the chest.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Yes, he did say something about a chest.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: If the company controls the chest, they controls the sea.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: A truly discomforting notion, love.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: And bad. Bad for every mother's son what calls himself a pirate. I think there's a bit more speed to be coaxed from these sails. Brace the foreyard!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Might I inquire how as to how you came by these?

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Persuasion.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Friendly?

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Decidedly not.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Will strikes a deal for these and upholds it with honor. Yet you're the one standing here with the prize. Full pardon, commission as a privateer on behalf of England and the East India Trading Company. As if I could be bought for such a low price.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Jack, the Letters, give them back.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: No. Persuade me.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: You do know Will taught me how handle a sword.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: As I said... Persuade me.  [Elizabeth walks away frustrated, leans on the ship's railing]

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: It's a curious thing. There was a time when I would've given anything for you to look like that while thinking about me.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: I don't know what you mean.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Oh, I think you do.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Oh, don't be absurd. I trust him, that's all.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: So you never wondered how your *latest* fianc ended up on the Flying Dutchman in the first place?

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: Strange thing to come upon a longboat so far out in open waters.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Just put as many leagues behind us as you can. As fast as you can.

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: And what are we running from?  [Will sees Elizabeth's white wedding dress on a chair in the cabin]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: That dress. Where did you get it?

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: It was found aboard the ship. The crew it thought it was a spirit bringing some omen of ill fate.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: That's foolish.

Speaker: quartermaster
Dialogue: Oh, yes. ?Proceededly foolish.

Speaker: bursar
Dialogue: It brought good fortune! The spirit told us... Put in at Tortuga. And we made a nice bit of profit there.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I imagine... some of your crew may have jumped ship there.

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: Why do you ask?

Speaker: messenger sailor
Dialogue: Captain, a ship's been spotted.

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: Colors?

Speaker: messenger sailor
Dialogue: She isn't flyin' any.

Speaker: bellamy
Dialogue: Pirates!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Or worse.

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: deck

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: You will watch this.  [crewmen are whipped, in order to turn a large screw that raises the Kraken summoning device]

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Let no joyful voice be heard! Let no man look up at the sky with hope! And let this day be cursed by we who ready to wake... the *Kraken*!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I've doomed us all.  It's the Flying Dutchman!

Speaker: bursar
Dialogue: Oh, Mother Cary's chickens. What happened?

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: deck

Speaker: maccus
Dialogue: The boy's not here. He must've been claimed by the sea.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: *I* am the sea.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: You need time alone with your thoughts.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: There are no survivors.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: The chest is no longer safe. Chart a course to Isla Cruces. Get me there first, or there'll be the devil to pay.

Speaker: koleniko
Dialogue: First?

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Who sent that thieving charlatan onto my ship? Who told them of the key? Jack Sparrow.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: My tremendous intuitive sense of the female creature informs me that you are troubled.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: I just thought I'd be married by now. I'm so ready to be married.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You know...  Lizzy... I *am*... captain of a ship. And *being* captain of a ship, I could in fact perform a... marriage. Right here. Right on this deck. Right... *now*!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: No, thank you.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Why not? We *are* very much alike, you and I. I and you. Us.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Oh. Except for a sense of honor, and decency and-and a moral center. And personal hygiene.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Trifles. You *will* come over to my side, I know it.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: You seem very certain.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: One word love: curiosity. You long for freedom. You long to do what you want to do because you want it. To act on selfish impulse. You want to see what it's like. One day, you won't be able to resist.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Why doesn't your Compass work?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Uh my Compass works fine.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Because you and I *are* alike, and there will come a moment when you have a chance to show it. To do the right thing.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I *love* those moments. I like to wave at them as they pass by.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: You'll have the chance to do something... something courageous. And when you do, you'll discover something: that you're a good man.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: All evidence to the contrary.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: I have faith in you. Want to know why?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Do tell, dearie.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Curiosity. You're going to want it. A chance to be admired. And gain the rewards that follow. You won't be able to resist. You're going to want to know... what it tastes like.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I *do* want to know what it tastes like.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: But - seeing as you're a good man I know you will *never* put me in a position that would compromise my honor.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: I'm proud of you, Jack.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I want my jar of dirt.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: You're pullin' too fast.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: You're pulling too slow. We don't want the Kraken to catch us.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: I'm savin' me strength for when it comes. And I don't think it's Krack-en, anyways. I always heard it said Kray-kin.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: What, with a long A?

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Aye.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: No-no-no-no-no-no-no. Krock-en's how it's pronounced in the original Scandinavian, and Krack-en's closer to that.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Well we ain't original Scandinavians, are we? Kray-ken!

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: It's a mythological creature, I can calls it what I wants.

Speaker: isla cruces
Dialogue: beach  [their longboat arrives at the beach, Jack disembarks and begins to walk off]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Guard the boat, mind the tide... Don't touch my dirt.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: This doesn't work. And it *certainly* doesn't show you what you want most.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Yes it *does*. You're sitting on it!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Beg your pardon?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Move.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: "Mind the tide."

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: I ?can/?may join the circus!

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: ?Don't ?mind ?if I shine your shoes, Sir?

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: deck  [Jones is watching Pintel and Ragetti on the beach through a spyglass]

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: They're here. And I cannot step foot on land again for near of a decade.

Speaker: maccus
Dialogue: Then trust us to act in your stead.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: I'll trust you know what awaits should you *fail*! Down, then!

Speaker: maccus
Dialogue: Down!

Speaker: isla cruces
Dialogue: beach

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: It's real!

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: You actually *were* telling the truth.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I do that quite a lot. Yet people are always surprised.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: With good reason!  [Will has unexpectedly appeared on the beach, walking up toward them]

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Will! You're alright! Thank God! I came to find you!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: How did you get here?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Sea turtles, mate. A pair of them, strapped to my feet.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Not so easy, is it?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: But I do owe you thanks, Jack.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: You do?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: After you tricked me onto that ship to square your debt with Jones.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I was reunited with my father.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Oh! Well... you're welcome, then.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Everything you said to me... every word, was a lie!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Pretty much. Time and tide, love.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Oy! What're you doing?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I'm gonna kill Jones.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Can't let you do that, William. 'Cause if Jones is dead, who's to call his terrible beastie off the hunt, eh? Now. If you please: The key.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: I keep the promises I make, Jack. I intend to free my father. I hope you're here to see it.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: I can't let you do that, either. So sorry.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I knew you'd warm up to me eventually.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Lord Beckett desires the contents of that chest. I deliver it, and get my life back.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Ah. The dark side of ambition.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Oh, I prefer to see it as the promise of redemption.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Stop it!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Jack!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Guard the chest!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: *No*!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: This is bar-*baric*! This is *no* way for grown men to settle - ! Oh! Fine! Let's just - *pull* out our swords and start *banging* away at each other! *This will solve everything!* I've had it! I've had enough! Wobbly-legged, rum-soaked... *pirates*!

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: How'd this go all screwy?

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Well, each wants the chest for hisself, don't 'e? Mister Norrington, I think he's tryna regain a bit of honor. Old Jack's lookin' to trade it, save his own skin. And Turner there - I figure 'e's tryna... settle some unresolved business 'twixt him and his twice-cursed pirate father.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Sad. That chest must be worth more 'n a shiny penny.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Oh! Tsk-tsk-tsk. Terrible temptation.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: If we was any kind of *decent*, we'd remove temptation from their path.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Will! *Enough!*

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Oh! Oh...! The heat!

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: By your leave, Mister Turner.

Speaker: isla cruces
Dialogue: church

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: By *your* leave, Mister Norrington.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Do excuse me while I kill the man who ruined my life.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Be my guest.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Let us examine that claim for a moment, former Commodore, shall we? Who was it, who at the very moment you had a notorious pirate safely behind bars, saw fit to *free* said pirate, and take your dearly beloved all to hisself, hey? So who's fault is it, *really*, that you've ended up a rum-pot deckhand what takes orders from pirates?

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Enough!  [Jack somersaults off the roof to escape, Norrington turns to Will]

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Unfortunately, Mister Turner... He's *right*!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Still rooting for you, mate!  [Jack picks up his sword from the ground, and puts the key around his neck]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Wup!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Woah!  [the key that Jack had around his neck falls off into the wheel]

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: 'Ello, Poppet.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Sword!

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Sword!

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Sword!

Speaker: hadrus
Dialogue: Aya! Uh ?seech!  Aunido! Aunido! Follow my voice! Follow my voice! To the left, uh... No, to the right... Go to the left...

Speaker: hadrus
Dialogue: No... That's a tree.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Oh, shut it.

Speaker: isla cruces
Dialogue: beach  [Jack is the first to arrive back at the longboat on the beach]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Jar of dirt!  [Jack opens his jar of dirt, dumps out some dirt, puts the heart in the jar, scoops handfuls of dirt back into the jar]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Right!  [Pintel & Ragetti attempt to escape by longboat, but Will blocks their progress]

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Come on, Turner!  [Jack fights with Koleniko, using an oar, subdues him]  [Will sees the key in the chest, Jack notices Will looking at the key and chest]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Leave him lie! Unless you plan on using him to hit something with.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: We're not getting out of this.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Not with the chest. Into the boat.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: You're mad.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Don't wait for me.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Uh, I say we respect his final wish.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Aye!  [the remaining Black Pearl crew escape by longboat]  [Hadrus is holding his conch shell head under one arm, the head speaks to Norrington]

Speaker: hadrus
Dialogue: Your bravery is wasted. I shall pry the chest away from your cold... dead... hands.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Here you go!

Speaker: hadrus
Dialogue: Oo!

Speaker: hadrus
Dialogue: Uh! ?Ando! Aunido! Aunido!  Pirates!

Speaker: hadrus
Dialogue: ?Vengo ?kowmpenay ?lachay. Hey! ?Hovaya!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: What happened to the chest?

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Norrington took it to draw them off.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: You're pulling too hard!

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: You're not pulling hard enough!

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Where's the Commodore?

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: He fell behind.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: My prayers be with him. Best not wallow in our grief. The bright side is: You're back. And made it off free and clear.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Lord almighty.?us.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: I'll handle this, mate.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Hey! Fishface! Lose something? Hey? Oup!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Got it!  [Jack stands up, struts across the deck, holding his jar of dirt]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Come to negotiate, eh, have you, you slimy git? Look what I got.  I got a jar of dirt! I got a jar of dirt! And guess what's inside it?

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Enough!  [the Flying Dutchman's cannon covers slide down, cannons emerge from the holes]

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Hard to starboard.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: *Hard to starboard!*

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Brace up the foreyard!

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Hard to starboard!

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Send his beloved Pearl back to the depths!

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Let them taste the triple guns.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: She's falling behind!

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Aye, and we've got her!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: We're the faster?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Against the wind the Dutchman beats us. That's how she takes her prey. But *with* the wind...

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: We rob her advantage.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Ah!

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: deck

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: They're out of range! ?Break ?out ?run ###

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: My father is *on* that ship. If we can outrun her, we can take her. We should turn and fight.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Why fight when you can negotiate? All one needs... is the proper leverage.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Where is it? Where is the thump-thump?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: No. It's not a reef! Get away from the rail!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: The Kraken. To arms!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: ?It'll ?attack the starboard. I've seen it before. ?Break out the cannons and hold for my signal.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Easy, boys!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Will?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Steady! Steady.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Will?

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Hold. Hold...

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: I think we've held fire long enough.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: *Will?*

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: *Fire...*!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: It'll be back. We have to get off the ship.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: There's no boats.  [Will sees the wrecked boats, then sets his eyes on the barrels of gunpowder]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Pull the grates! Get all the gunpowder onto the net in the cargo hold.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Whatever you do, don't miss.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: As soon as you're clear.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: There's only half a dozen kegs of powder!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Then load the rum!  [Gibbs seems shocked, then turns to see the entire crew halted, staring at him in shocked silence]

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Aye! The rum, too!  [the crew continues loading]  [aerial view approaching Black Pearl, zooming through the rigging to the other side]

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Step to!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Oh you coward!

Speaker: marty
Dialogue: Not good.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: ?Pull ?away!

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Heave! Heave like you're being paid for it!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Euh! Come on!I'm over here! Come on!

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Shoot! Elizabeth, shoot!

Speaker: marty
Dialogue: Did we kill it?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: No. We just made it angry. We're not out of this yet. Captain! Orders!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Abandon ship. Into the longboat.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Jack! The Pearl!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: She's only a ship, mate.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: He's right, we have to head for land.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: 'S a lot o' open wa'er.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: That's a lot o' wa'er.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: We have to try. We can get away as it takes down the Pearl.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Abandon ship. Abandon ship or abandon hope.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Thank you, Jack.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: We're not free yet, love.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: You came back. I always knew you were a good man.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Prepare to cast off! There's no time to lose! Come on, Will, step to!

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: It's after you, not the ship. It's not us. This is the only way, don't you see? I'm not sorry.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Pirate.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Where's Jack?

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: He elected to stay behind to give us a chance.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Bugger, bugger, bugger, bugger, bugger, bugger...!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Come on... Come on...

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Not so bad.

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Oh!

Speaker: jack sparrow
Dialogue: Hello, beastie.  [slow motion scene of Jack boldy charging toward the Kraken's mouth, sword drawn] [Q3]

Speaker: flying dutchman
Dialogue: deck

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Jack Sparrow. Our debt is settled.

Speaker: koleniko
Dialogue: The captain goes down with his ship.

Speaker: maccus
Dialogue: Turns out not even Jack Sparrow can best the devil.

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Open the chest. Open the chest, I need to see it!

Speaker: davy jones
Dialogue: Damn you, Jack Spar-*row*!

Speaker: port royal
Dialogue: EITC headquarters

Speaker: mercer
Dialogue: The last of our ships has returned.

Speaker: mercer
Dialogue: None. But... one of the ships did pick up a man adrift at sea. He had these.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: I took the liberty of filling in my name.

Speaker: norrington
Dialogue: Better.  The heart of Davy Jones.

Speaker: bayou
Dialogue: Tia's shack  [the remaining crew paddles through the waters to Tia Dalma's shack]

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Against de cold... and de sorrow.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: It's a shame. I know you're t'inking that wid the Pearl, you coulda captured the devil and set free your fadder's soul.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Doesn't matter now. The Pearl's gone. Along with its captain.

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Aye. And already the world seems a bit less bright. He fooled us all right to the end. But I guess that honest streak finally won out. To Jack Sparrow!

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Never another like Captain Jack.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: He was a gentleman of fortune, he was.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: He was a good man.  [they all take a drink out of their mugs, except Elizabeth]

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: If there was anything could be done to bring him back...  Elizabeth...

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Would you do it? Hmmm?  What... would you? Hmmm? What would *any* of you be willing to do? Hmmm? Would you sail to the ends of the eart', and beyond, to fetch back ?witty Jack and 'im precious Pearl?

Speaker: gibbs
Dialogue: Aye.

Speaker: pintel
Dialogue: Aye.

Speaker: ragetti
Dialogue: Aye.

Speaker: cotton's parrot
Dialogue: Awk! Aye.

Speaker: elizabeth swann
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: will turner
Dialogue: Aye.

Speaker: tia dalma
Dialogue: Alright. But if you're goin' brave de weird, and haunted shores, at world's end, den... you will need a captain who knows dose waters.

Speaker: barbossa
Dialogue: So tell me, what's become of my ship?
